column4: i'm not having much luck with linux this week
if i've already set up my partitions, how do I skip that step in the installer?
are you using the livecd installer?
yes
just select manual I guess and point / to whichever part you want.
and /swap etc....
i tried that, but it says "you must specify a root file system", even when I have :/
Yeah you have to pick which partition you want to use as /
the error i get is: No root file system
any reason not to use the installers partitioner?
i already set up my partitions before installing windows
Yeah you also have to check that / is going to be formated.
the other option is just to remove the partitions you create and just let it install to the freespace.
if you want a seperate /home you would have to specify that.
no
you can also specify to keep packages at their current version
http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-161660.html
and tom__, how do I do those?
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=161190 (http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=161190  is the link explainign it I believe
thanks :)
basically sudo aptitude hold <packagename>
thanks :)
